title: MED Vol.80, No.87
content:
Exploring the Intersection of AI and Creativity:  (Futurewowks)

Separate and Reassemble: Generative AI Through the Lens of Art and Media Histories (manovich.net)

Large language models can do jaw-dropping things. But nobody knows exactly why.  (MIT)

Our Office Avatar pt 1: The office is talking shit again (harper blog)

The changing face of protest  (restofworld)

We’re All in this Together A Year in Review of Zero-Days Exploited In-the-Wild in 2023  (google)

Image Anonymization  (api4)

Introducing DBRX: A New State-of-the-Art Open LLM –  [HF Space]   (databricks)

Worldcoin hit with another ban order in Europe citing risks to kids  (techcrunch)

Why Bluesky Remains The Most Interesting Experiment In Social Media, By Far (techdirt)

Sora First Impressions  (openai) example

Will Anduril create the AI weaponry that will be as decisive to the outcome of war as the atomic bomb? “We have ideas for what they are,” Luckey says. “We are working on them.”  (Financial Times)
author: MDG
